channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Third assassination attempt on Donald Trump? Armed man arrested from Coachella
item.description: The suspect has been identified as Vem Miller who was carrying a fake press card and entry pass. He is believed to be a member of a rightwing anti-government organization and was plotting to kill Trump, the Sheriff said. "They were different enough to cause the deputies alarm," Bianco said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump says US citizens 'should be easily handled by military if necessary'
item.description: ​"We have two enemies: We have the outside enemy, and then we have the enemy from within. And the enemy from within, in my opinion, is more dangerous than China, Russia and all these countries," Trump said. "It should be easily handled by, if necessary, by the National Guard, or if really necessary, by the military," Trump said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UFO drones are spying on US military bases: Why can't the Pentagon stop them?
item.description: Mysterious drones have been surveilling sensitive US military sites in Virginia and Nevada, including Naval Station Norfolk. Federal laws and risks prevent the military from shooting them down or jamming their signals. Investigations are ongoing, with suspicions of foreign involvement but no official identification yet.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Yes, I do regret it': Liz Cheney on her past support for Donald Trump
item.description: Liz Cheney expresses regret over supporting Donald Trump and endorses Kamala Harris for the 2024 presidential race. Cheney, a vocal critic of Trump post-January 6, also campaigns with Harris, marking significant Republican defiance of former party lines.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Elon Musk explains how SpaceX's Mechazilla can catch Super Heavy booster
item.description: SpaceX successfully flew a 233-foot rocket booster back to its launch site and caught it mid-air using Mechazilla's mechanical arms. The Super Heavy Booster, weighing about 250 tons, was captured after a test flight. "When the engines land... it's gonna drop the velocity to basically zero and come in between the arms. The arms will be wide, and as it's coming in, the arms will, will close, go flush against the side of the vehicle, and the vehicle will be descending through the arms. The probability is uncertain, but it is above zero," Elon explained.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'It’s time to pick a side': Dennis Quaid, ‘Reagan’ actor, rallies for Donald Trump in California
item.description: Actor Dennis Quaid, advocating for former President Donald Trump, spoke in Coachella, California, urging the crowd to choose between supporting the Constitution or modern trends like TikTok. He drew parallels between Reagan's and Trump's eras, critiquing current policies under Biden and praised Trump's past achievements.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: IDF uncovers underground shaft, captures Hezbollah terrorist
item.description: The Israeli military has discovered a Hezbollah tunnel shaft in southern Lebanon, leading to an underground bunker containing weapons and supplies. A Hezbollah operative, found inside, surrendered and has been detained for interrogation. The tunnel, extending 50 square meters at a depth of seven meters, was designed for prolonged underground use.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: What! Documentary claims King Charles piloted a UFO in 1975!
item.description: The King of UFOs explores the British Royal Family's interest in UFOs and the paranormal and it has an interview of a person who claims to be an eyewitness to King Charles piloting a UFO in Canada in 1975. The maker of the film Christopher Lee said the claims might be quite far-fetched but it does seem possible after his research work.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump hints at this role for Elon Musk if he wins the presidency again...
item.description: Elon Musk could assume the role of 'Secretary of Cost-Cutting' in a potential Trump administration, focusing on efficiency. Trump lauded Musk's business acumen and space ambitions. Musk actively campaigns for Trump, emphasizing free speech concerns and advocating against a Kamala Harris presidency.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Fart of the deal: Mark and Mary fail to move MAGA devout from 'Diaper Don'
item.description: Top American general calls Trump a 'total fascist' and 'most dangerous person ever,' while Trump critics’ relentless attacks strengthen his support. Trump's derogatory remarks and scandals incite backlash, but polling shows no significant shift in voter support. Revenge themes dominate Trump's campaign rhetoric.
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: 'Shocking and monumental in scale': UK woman sentenced to life after killing parents, living with bodies for four years
item.description: Virginia McCullough, 36, has been sentenced to life in prison with a minimum of 36 years for murdering her parents, Lois and John McCullough, in Great Baddow. Virginia poisoned her father and fatally beat and stabbed her mother, concealing their bodies for years for financial gain.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Human head found in a box on Chicago street; investigation underway
item.description: A man's evening walk in Chicago took a gruesome turn when he discovered a human head in a box on West Taylor Street, mistaking it initially for a Halloween prop. Police and the Cook County Medical Examiner’s Office are investigating, with autopsy results pending. Authorities are also probing another case of skeletal remains found near the Kennedy Expressway in Bucktown.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Disgusting': Gretchen Whitmer says sorry for Dorito-feeding video after Catholics say 'zero votes for Harris'
item.description: Michigan governor Gretchen Whitmer apologized for a video seen as mocking the Catholic sacrament, where she fed a Dorito chip to an influencer. The video was intended to promote the Chips Act and support Kamala Harris' campaign. Whitmer expressed regret for any offense caused and clarified it was never meant to disparage anyone's faith.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Harris-Walz campaign aims for rural votes with bird hunt, Trump calls it a desperate bid for male support
item.description: Tim Walz, running mate of Kamala Harris, highlighted his rural background while participating in Minnesota’s pheasant hunting season. The outing was part of the 'Hunters and Anglers for Harris-Walz' initiative, aimed at appealing to rural voters and sportspeople. Despite not bagging any birds, the event was celebrated with a community luncheon.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: NBC poll says Trump and Harris are now tied at 48 per cent. Details here
item.description: An NBC poll shows Donald Trump and Kamala Harris tied at 48% support each. Trump gained four points since September, while Harris dropped by one. Key findings indicate significant gender and demographic gaps. Republican pollster McInturff said Harris' popularity waned as the vice president does not represent change from President Joe Biden and voters see Trump's presidency in a more positive light than Biden's. "She is asking for another term from the incumbent party," McInturff said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Barron Trump's former 'girlfriend' says the reason for their breakup was...
item.description: Though Barron's life is kept under the wraps, he's been linked to three women -- mostly through speculations. After Maddie, Barron apparently dated some Sarah Claire and now he has been dating model Klara Jones for the past six months, reportedly. Klara is two years older than Barron Trump. Some reports claimed Klara was seen with Barron Trump at many get togethers in the last six months.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Back home to mommy...': Trump's message to hecklers at Coachella rally
item.description: CNN reported how Donald Trump's rhetoric has gotten darker in the last leg of the campaigning. Politico White House reporter Daniel Lippman on the CNN show said it was not surprising and reminds one of his violent words in 2016 against protesters: 'Take them out on the stretcher'. "He feels the walls have closed in on him. That he faces potential jail time with criminal cases. If he loses this election, then there is a good chance that he will be in prison...he has gone darker," Lippman said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Woman sues haunted house after breaking both ankles at the tourist attraction
item.description: Solainne Moncero-Tannis sues A Haunting in Hollis after breaking both ankles on a 20-foot slide. The haunted house has been shut down due to safety violations, including structural and electrical issues. This marks the fifth lawsuit against the attraction for injuries.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'The big project': The secret strategy behind Hamas' surprise attack on Israel on Oct 7
item.description: Hamas leaders, including Yahya Sinwar, spent over two years planning an attack on Israel, revealed in documents obtained by The New York Times. They sought involvement from Iran and Hezbollah. The attack, initially planned for 2022, aimed to disrupt Israel's normalisation with Saudi Arabia and assert control over regional disputes.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why King Charles has not disclosed the list of gifts Royal Family received since 2020
item.description: ​Anti-monarchy campaign group Republic has hit out at the Royal Family and said if politicians are expected to display higher standards by mandatory disclosure of gifts, the same should be demanded from the royals as well. Graham Smith, chief executive of Republic, said: “If politicians are being lambasted for failing to declare gifts, the same should apply to the royals.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
